original_definition: 'frequency restoration process' means a process that aims at restoring frequency to the nominal frequency and, for synchronous areas consisting of more than one LFC area, a process that aims at restoring the power balance to the scheduled value;

Article 3: ‘frequency restoration process’ or ‘FRP’ means a process that aims at restoring frequency to the nominal frequency and, for synchronous areas consisting of more than one LFC area, a process that aims at restoring the power balance to the scheduled value;

‘frequency restoration process’ or ‘FRP’ means a process that aims at restoring frequency to the nominal frequency and, for synchronous areas consisting of more than oneLFC area, a process that aims at restoring the power balance to thescheduled value;
Article 120: the appointment of the TSO responsible for the implementation and operation of the frequency restoration process in accordance with Article 143(4).
Article 143: 4.   Where aLFC areaconsists of more than onemonitoring area, all TSOs of the LFC area shall appoint one TSO in the LFC area operational agreement responsible for the implementation and operation of thefrequency restoration process.

4.   Where a LFC area consists of more than one monitoring area, all TSOs of the LFC area shall appoint one TSO in the LFC area operational agreement responsible for the implementation and operation of the frequency restoration process.
Article 145: 1.   Each TSO of eachLFC areashall implement an automaticfrequency restoration process(‘aFRP’) and a manual frequency restoration process (‘mFRP’).
1.   Each TSO of each LFC area shall implement an automatic frequency restoration process (‘aFRP’) and a manual frequency restoration process (‘mFRP’).
